{"step_by_step_thinking": "VLDL stands for Very Low-Density Lipoprotein. It is a type of lipoprotein made by the liver. It is responsible for transporting triglycerides and cholesterol from the liver to other tissues in the body. The GIT, or gastrointestinal tract, is not involved in the synthesis of VLDL.", "answer_choice": "B. Liver"}
